I wish you all the best for your health now and in the future :)

Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and terrified HCP HCP

Posts.Content: HCP wrote: Hi everyone I found a lump in my left breast a couple of weeks ago. It's relatively hard, painless, and can only be felt when I'm lying down. i am 32, no family history, and to make matters a bit more stressful, also currently 31 weeks pregnant with my first. After doing a breast exam my OB recommended I go for an ultrasound ' just to be safe'. At the ultrasound, the sonographer was incredibly reassuring, he kept telling me he wasn't worried, that it just looked like a cluster of breast tissue or perhaps a hematoma but either way he was not concerned at all. He went to show the images to the radiologist who also didn't feel the need to come into the room and take another look. As I was leaving he again reassured me that I wouldn't need to worry about following up, everything was fine, blah blah blah. Imagine my surprise when my doctor called two days later saying the report he received from the ultrasound said the lump needed further investigation and to be biopsied. I'm feeling all kinds of emotions now, anger at the radiologist/sonographer - why would they tell me it was nothing and then send off a report saying something entirely different? Very frustrating. I can't get in for a biopsy for another week and i know after that it could be awhile before i get my results. Basically, I'm terrified and my mood is swinging between thinking it will be ok to planning my own funeral. I know this level of stress isn't healthy for my baby either. I have been in tears all day and just hoping to chat (and provide support) to anyone else who has found themselves in a similar situation xx Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and terrified HCP HCP

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2017 12:29PM HCP wrote: Thank you! So hard not to worry!

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2017 03:52PM HCP wrote: Hi everyone, I just got back from the doctors and my biopsy results indicate it is completely benign, which is a huge relief! Apparently the lump is a lactation adenoma, common in pregnant women. It is a relief but has been an absolutely torturous week waiting for the results. Wishing all of you the best for benign results too!

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2017 03:38AM HCP wrote: Hi Patricia, I wouldn't say you've underreacted, so many of those symptoms can be caused by a number of benign breast conditions, but definitely important to get it checked out. I'm currently waiting a biopsy for a lump I found a couple of weeks ago so understand your anxiety, but best to get it checked out sooner rather than later. It will probably turn out to be something benign, all the best and sorry to hear about your other health issues!

Posts.Title: Had my biopsy this afternoon. GrammaSue Adelozier

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2017 12:43AM HCP wrote: Hi LAPM, I just got my results back today, thankfully it is benign. It turns out the solid mass I have is a lactation adenoma (a collection of tissue that can resemble a malignant tumour but is common in pregnant/breastfeeding women from what I have been told). Very much relieved. It has definitely been a very long two weeks from my initial ultrasound to the biopsy and then the results today. Your BIRADS of 4b makes me feel optimistic that you will also get benign results. 80% is a reassuring statistic. I don't know what my birads was, they never gave me one but it must have been a 4 for the biopsy to be ordered in the first place. Please keep us updated, and wishing you all the best for B9 results next week :)
Posts.Title: Had my biopsy this afternoon. GrammaSue Adelozier
